intro: Byttneria pannosa, commonly known as the African silk tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, flat seeds. It is often found in savanna and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. The species is notable for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
